recipe.name: Tomato Tartlets
recipe.notes: Serve with a rocket and green lentil salad.

ingredient_item.ingredient: vegan margarine (or half as much coconut oil)

listInstructions.instruction: Cut onion and fry with the olive oil in a pan on a medium heat for a few minutes, or as long as it takes to start going translucent.

Slice the tomatoes in half and then add to the onion. Crush the garlic and mix in as well. Let it cook for a couple of minutes then add the tomato purée. Cook for another few minutes, seasoning to taste. Leave to cool.
Make the pastry wash by mixing the margarine, soy milk and syrup.
Roll out the puff pastry and cut into squares (two per person is usually ideal). Score a square inside each one to give it a border. Brush the wash onto these borders.
Place the cooked tomato mixture into the centre of each pastry square. Put in the oven for around 10-20 minutes, until the edges of the pastry have puffed up and are golden.
While it's cooking, blend the silken tofu with the pesto to make a pesto cream.
Serve the pastries alongside the creamy tofu and a salad (suggested: rocket and green lentil)
